item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mason Cooley
item.description: "I tried good taste, but the strain was too much for me. " -- Mason Cooley

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If cats looked like frogs we'd realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That's what people remember." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Indeed I have always been of the opinion that hard work is simply the refuge of people who have nothing to do." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I can resist anything except temptation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Moderation is a fatal thing. Nothing succeeds like excess." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every woman is a rebel." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Why should we take advice on sex from the pope? If he knows anything about it, he shouldn't!" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Pasteboard pies and paper flowers are being banished from the stage by the growth of that power of accurate observation which is commonly called cynicism by those who have not got it...." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Heterosexuality is not normal, it's just common." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description:
"There's a hell of a distance between wise-cracking and wit. Wit has truth in it; wise-cracking is simply calisthenics with words."
[<i>Interview, The Paris Review</i>, Summer 1956]" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Sex is an emotion in motion." -- Mae West

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Madonna
item.description: "Sick and perverted always appeals to me." -- Madonna

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Sex is kicking death in the ass while singing." -- Charles Bukowski
